greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), 0 <= k <= n, composed of k-Catalan numbers.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..55, flattened
Lun Lv, Zhihong Liu, Some Identities Related to Restricted Lattice Paths, 2016 9th International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design (ISCID), pp. 338-340.
example: This sequence formatted as a square array:
maple: T:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(k=n, 1, add(
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 10 2017
mathematica: nmax = 10; col[k_] := col[k] = Module[{A}, A[_] = 0; Do[A[x_] = Normal[1/(1 - x*A[k*x]) + O[x]^(nmax-k+1)], {nmax-k+1}]; CoefficientList[A[x], x]];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, nmax}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 05 2019, using g.f. given for column sequences *)
xref: The column sequences (without leading zeros) are A000012, A000108 (Catalan), A015083, A015084, A015085, A015086, A015089, A015091, A015092, A015093, A015095, A015096 for k=0..11.
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Jan 20 2004, Oct 16 2008
